resources.string: App opens automatically as soon as an eMeal card is discovered.
If there is a WiFi connection, the map of Dresden gets downloaded to the device when you start the map.
Some apps just share the image without text if this option is activated.

A big thank you to the just mentioned developers, who published their source code as free software and thus supported the development of mensaDD.

Furthermore many thanks to Paul for his support during implementation and to the Perry Rhodan Youth for testing during development.

And last but not least I'd like to give a big thanks to all the people who use this app and their useful feedback! ;-)

The NFC balance check uses source code from Jakob Wenzel and Farebot. The graph visualization of the balance history has been realized with hellocharts. The map view uses the Mapbox Android SDK.\n\nThe source code of mensaDD is available onGitHub, licensed under GPL.

I am not liable for any inaccuracies in the meal data.
The meal information gets downloaded from the website of the Studentenwerk Dresden and parsed by an external server.

If you have any wishes or suggestions, just write me an E-Mail!
